_header: Hail glorious Virgin ground of all our grace
Subjects: hymns, to Virgin Mary; Virgin Mary, joys of
_description: A hymn on the Five Joys, ascribed to an anchoress of Maunsfeld by Shirley (1713-1, Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 59 (SC 6943)) and to Lydgate by Stow (1713-3, London, British Library Addit. 29729) — five 8-line stanzas

BodAsh59.First Lines:
HEille glorious virgyne grounde of al oure graceHeyle mayde and
                    moder in virgyniteeHeyle whame þe sone of god cheesse for his
                    placeSent frome above þane frome þe faders
                    place…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Heyle sawe to seeke vs synners sende socourþees ioyes
                    fyve surmountinge in oure mynde
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Nowe foloweþe here nexst a devoute and holy salutacoun of oure ladye
                    made by an holy Ankaresse of Maunsffeld (f. 68); An holy salutacoun by an
                    Ankasse (RT)
BodAsh59.Editions:
Barratt,  Alexandra,
                        ed.  
             Women’s Writing in Middle English.
         London: Longman, 1992: 277-9.

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Heyl gloryous virgyne ground of all our graceHeyl modere of crist
                    in pure virginite…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Heyl salue to seke vs synners send socoureThese Ioyes fyve
                    empryntynge in oure mynd
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Ends ‘Amen’ at end of last line and ‘Explicit’
                    in lower margin in scribe’s hand, f. 135.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Quinque Gaudia (in upper margin, f. 135); Quinque vulnera quinque
                        gaudia (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents, encompassing 6132 as well)
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “Lydgatiana.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         131 (1913): 40-63: 49-50.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 53-4.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Heyl gloryous virgyne ground of all owr graceheyl mother of cryst
                    in pure virginite…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…heyl salve to seke vs synners sende socourethes Ioyes fyve
                    empryntynge in your mynde
